I very much like Caravelle.  The food is distinct, if more Anglo-Saxon in style than anything else.    Indeed, this is perhaps why I go here...When I yearn for a taste of the English-speaking world, I pop into Caravelle.  The space is clean, minimalist, simple, and bright.  The staff is cordial, multilingual.  My only real complaints have to do with the relationship between quality and cost.  There are some pretty darned excellent restaurants right around here, and if you're looking for a good bite to eat, I would recommend one of Caravelle's neighboring gems.  That said, this is a quality, if pricey, choice.
